definition: down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: Aunt Petunia looked as though she'd just swallowed a lemon.
sentences.chinese: 帕特尼亞看起來像剛剛嚥下了一個檸檬。

sentences.english: Jack swallowed hard as he watched the black Mercedes speed away.
sentences.chinese: 傑克艱難地嚥下一口唾沫，看着黑色奔馳車絕塵而去。

sentences.english: If a turtle ingests this, it can cause problems.
sentences.chinese: 如果龜嚥下這一點，可能會導致問題。

sentences.english: Mouth of delicious haven't swallow, dining-room free performances again.
sentences.chinese: 嘴裏的美味還沒嚥下去，餐廳的免費演出又開始了。

sentences.english: The accumulation of unswallowed saliva in the pharynx causes the sensation of choking .
sentences.chinese: 不能嚥下的唾液積聚在咽部引起窒息感。

sentences.english: We would dry the wood in the sun and eat it.
sentences.chinese: 我們會在太陽下先把木頭曬乾，再嚥下。

sentences.english: The girl swallows a lump at her throat.
sentences.chinese: 女孩嚥下哽在喉嚨裏的東西。

sentences.english: He ate the black bread with the blood.
He curled them between his palms at whiles and swallowed them softly.
sentences.chinese: 他不時她用雙掌把它搓成小卷兒，輕輕地嚥下去。

sentences.english: Simon Edwards stepped forward, swallowing the frog in his throat.
sentences.chinese: 愛德華茲走上前，他強嚥下沁入喉中的霧水。
她嚥下自己的鹹鹹的眼淚。

sentences.english: He wandered off, sipping the last of his latte.
sentences.chinese: 伴隨着嚥下最後一口咖啡，他跑題了。

sentences.english: The child got the medicine down.
Longer course, dysphagia developed to a certain extent that is no longer aggravated .
sentences.chinese: 病程較長，嚥下困難發展至一定程度即不再加重。
這種藥物很容易嚥下去。

sentences.english: You should chew your food well before you swallow it.
sentences.chinese: 你應當先細嚼你的食物，然後再嚥下去。
